titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Milton Moore, Judgment
CWG4270

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Commonwealth
against } On a Warrant For a breach of the peace
Milton Moore
June 29, 1863 --
Judgement
Verdict of the Jury
We the men of the Jury find Milton Moore guilty of a breach of the peace and asses the fine on him Fifteen dollars & costs:

A Jury having been summoned and sworn according to law in this case and having herd the evidence assessed a fine of fifteen dollars on Milton Moore: It is therefore considered that the said Milton Moore make his fine to the commonwelth in the sume of fifteen dollars or in defaut of the payment thereof suffer seven and on half days imprismoment in the Jail of this county
Given under my hand this 29th day of June 1863
I J, W, Stewart do herby certify that the foregoing is a true trancript of the above case as it remains in my office
Given under my hand this 5th day of october 1863
